Title: SD-WAN Basics
TopicsCovered: What is SD-WAN; Underlay vs Overlay; Benefits over MPLS; Key concepts (ZTP, Orchestrator, Edges)
LearningObjectives: Explain SD-WAN purpose, identify core components, describe underlay vs overlay
PracticalLab: Concept lab: Draw architecture; Watch intro videos; Create glossary
LabSteps: 1) Sketch SD-WAN 3-plane architecture; 2) List 10 apps to prioritize
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Common misperception: SD-WAN is 'just internet'.  Issue: confusion on overlay vs underlay
TroubleshootingTips: Clarify overlay/underlay, map app flows to overlays, use diagrams
SuggestedResources: Intro articles, vendor docs (Cisco, VMware, Fortinet)

Title: Architecture â€“ 3 Planes
TopicsCovered: Management, Control, Data planes; Controllers and Orchestrators; Edge roles
LearningObjectives: Differentiate the 3 planes and name vendor equivalents
PracticalLab: Draw detailed 3-plane diagram; Map vendor component names
LabSteps: 1) Create a labeled diagram; 2) Map vManage/vSmart/vBond (Cisco) or equivalents
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Misconfigured role separation causing admin confusion
TroubleshootingTips: Ensure roles are assigned correctly in design docs; verify access controls

Title: Tunnels & Encryption
TopicsCovered: IPSec basics, DTLS/TLS, tunnel redundancy, BFD
LearningObjectives: Explain tunnel setup and encryption choices; understand BFD for fast failover
PracticalLab: Lab: Simple IPSec tunnel walkthrough; simulate link failure
LabSteps: 1) Configure IPSec template in lab; 2) Induce link down and observe BFD
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show crypto, show bfd status (vendor-specific commands)
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Tunnel flap after ISP changes MTU or NAT
TroubleshootingTips: Check MTU, NAT traversal, rekey timers, capture packets to identify fragmentation

Title: Application Recognition & DPI
TopicsCovered: DPI, app-aware routing, SLA metrics (latency/jitter/loss)
LearningObjectives: Identify apps via DPI and create SLA thresholds for steering
PracticalLab: Lab: Identify app flows using DPI; create policy to steer VoIP
LabSteps: 1) Generate VoIP/Video traffic; 2) Configure SLA policy and verify path selection
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show app-id, show sla stats
RealTimeIssues: Issue: App misclassification (e.g., webRTC as unknown)
TroubleshootingTips: Tune DPI signatures; whitelist critical services; update app signatures

Title: Routing Fundamentals for SD-WAN
TopicsCovered: OSPF/BGP basics, default route handling, LAN routing
LearningObjectives: Understand overlay routing protocols and interactions with underlay
PracticalLab: Lab: Configure OSPF on LAN side and default route to SD-WAN edge
LabSteps: 1) Configure OSPF neighbor; 2) Inject default route into overlay
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show ip route, show ospf neighbor, show bgp summary
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Route loops after redistribution
TroubleshootingTips: Validate route filters, route policies, and route tags

Title: Certificates & Device Identity
TopicsCovered: CA, certificates, ZTP, device authentication
LearningObjectives: Explain certificate workflows and secure device onboarding
PracticalLab: Lab: Simulate device onboarding with certificate issuance (conceptual or vendor trial)
LabSteps: 1) Generate CSR/keys (lab); 2) Attach device to orchestrator via ZTP
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show certificate status, show device inventory
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Device fails to authenticate due to wrong time/clock skew
TroubleshootingTips: Check NTP, certificate expiry, reissue certs if necessary

Title: Week 1 Review & Quiz
TopicsCovered: Review all Week1 topics; self-assessment quiz
LearningObjectives: Reinforce retention and identify weak areas
PracticalLab: Quiz + practical recap; re-draw architecture from memory
LabSteps: 1) Take quiz; 2) Recreate templates and diagrams
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Knowledge gaps discovered
TroubleshootingTips: Revise weak topics and retake exercises

Title: Vendor Selection & Comparison
TopicsCovered: Cisco, Fortinet, VMware, Aruba; pros/cons; licensing models
LearningObjectives: Understand vendor differences and match to business needs
PracticalLab: Lab: Read vendor datasheets; create pros/cons matrix
LabSteps: 1) Create 2-page vendor comparison with cost considerations
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Licensing surprises during rollout
TroubleshootingTips: Carefully review license SKUs and trial limitations with sales engineers

Title: Templates & Automation Basics
TopicsCovered: System templates, feature templates, device groups
LearningObjectives: Build repeatable templates for consistent deployments
PracticalLab: Lab: Create system and interface templates in vendor UI or simulated environment
LabSteps: 1) Build WAN/LAN interface templates; 2) Attach template to a test device
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show template status, show device config
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Template conflicts when applied to heterogeneous devices
TroubleshootingTips: Use templating variables and per-device overrides; test in staging

Title: Device Onboarding Workflow
TopicsCovered: Licensing, ZTP, controller discovery, certificate exchange
LearningObjectives: Master the exact steps to bring an edge online securely
PracticalLab: Lab: Zero Touch Provisioning demo (or simulated steps) and checklist creation
LabSteps: 1) Prepare onboarding checklist; 2) Simulate ZTP flow
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show onboarding logs, show device inventory
RealTimeIssues: Issue: ZTP blocked by firewall at branch
TroubleshootingTips: Open required ports, ensure DNS resolution to orchestrator, provide fallback manual provisioning

Title: Overlay Routing & OMP/BFD
TopicsCovered: OMP (Cisco) or vendor equivalents, route propagation, BFD tuning
LearningObjectives: Understand overlay routing and fast failure detection
PracticalLab: Lab: Observe OMP routes and BFD behavior; tune timers
LabSteps: 1) Show OMP route table; 2) Adjust BFD timers and observe failover
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show omp routes, show bfd sessions
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Unstable BFD causing route flaps
TroubleshootingTips: Tune BFD timers or adjust underlying link stability; check CPU

Title: Policy Types: Control & Data
TopicsCovered: Control policies, data (app) policies, enforcement order
LearningObjectives: Design and implement both control and data policies effectively
PracticalLab: Lab: Create control policy to block a prefix and data policy to prioritize app
LabSteps: 1) Push policies and test with traffic flows
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show policy hits, show flow statistics
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Policy precedence confusion leading to unexpected behavior
TroubleshootingTips: Review policy order and explicit deny/allow rules; use policy simulators

Title: Basic Security Controls
TopicsCovered: Edge firewall, URL filtering, IPS/IDS basics, segmentation
LearningObjectives: Apply essential security at the edge with SD-WAN features
PracticalLab: Lab: Implement firewall rules and a guest VLAN with internet-only access
LabSteps: 1) Configure firewall policies for corp vs guest; 2) Test access controls
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show firewall policies, show security events
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Overly permissive rules exposing sensitive services
TroubleshootingTips: Implement least-privilege, audit rules, and use logging to validate

Title: Small Lab Build & Validation
TopicsCovered: Combine prior components into a small working lab
LearningObjectives: Validate end-to-end onboarding, tunnels, policies, routing
PracticalLab: Lab: Build 2-branch + 1-hub topology in EVE-NG/GNS3 or vendor cloud lab
LabSteps: 1) Deploy edges, apply templates, verify tunnels and routing
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show tunnel status, show omp/bgp neighbors
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Interoperability quirks between lab images
TroubleshootingTips: Use vendor-supported lab images and verify versions

Title: Branch Topology Design
TopicsCovered: Branch with dual WAN, LAN switch, clients, IP planning
LearningObjectives: Design a resilient branch topology with proper addressing and VLANs
PracticalLab: Lab: Create IP plan and VLAN mapping for a branch
LabSteps: 1) Draw network maps and update IP plan spreadsheet
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: IP conflicts during migration
TroubleshootingTips: Perform IP audits before cutover and use NAT if needed temporarily

Title: Configure WAN Edge (CLI & UI)
TopicsCovered: Interface configuration, tunnel setup, control connections
LearningObjectives: Configure an edge device for production branch use
PracticalLab: Lab: Configure WAN interfaces, set TLOCs, verify control connections
LabSteps: 1) Apply interface templates; 2) Validate control connection and tunnels
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show interface, show control connections, show tlocs
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Edge not registering with controller
TroubleshootingTips: Check device serial, license, DNS, NAT, and outbound connectivity

Title: LAN Side Routing & Integration
TopicsCovered: OSPF adjacency to LAN devices, redistribution, VLANs
LearningObjectives: Integrate edge into LAN and ensure correct route propagation
PracticalLab: Lab: Configure OSPF between edge and access router; verify routes reach DC
LabSteps: 1) Establish OSPF adjacency; 2) Verify LSDB and route installation
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show ospf neighbor, show ip route
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Split-horizon or route filtering blocking routes
TroubleshootingTips: Review redistribution rules and interface configuration

Title: App Policies & SLA Enforcement
TopicsCovered: Create SLA-based steering policies and thresholds for apps
LearningObjectives: Ensure critical apps use best transport and meet SLA
PracticalLab: Lab: Build SLA profile and policy for VoIP and SaaS; validate steering
LabSteps: 1) Configure SLA probes; 2) Simulate degradation and confirm failover
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show sla probes, show policy decisions
RealTimeIssues: Issue: SLA probes not representative of real app behavior
TroubleshootingTips: Use realistic probe targets and multiple metrics (loss/latency/jitter)

Title: Segmentation & VPNs
TopicsCovered: Multiple VPNs, route leaking, security zones, micro-segmentation
LearningObjectives: Isolate traffic types and control inter-VPN access
PracticalLab: Lab: Implement Corp and Guest VPNs with controlled route leaking
LabSteps: 1) Configure VPN tags, implement ACLs and test cross-VPN access
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show vpn mappings, show route leaking status
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Route leakage allows undesired access
TroubleshootingTips: Tighten filters and apply explicit deny rules

Title: Failover & Resilience Testing
TopicsCovered: Test primary link down, partial degradation, controller failover
LearningObjectives: Validate behavior under link and controller failures
PracticalLab: Lab: Induce failures and document failover times and app behavior
LabSteps: 1) Cut primary link; 2) Measure reconvergence and app impact
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show failover stats, show bfd/omp status
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Slow failover impacting VoIP
TroubleshootingTips: Tune BFD and path selection, consider local remediation like QoS

Title: Mid-Course Assessment Lab
TopicsCovered: Full branch deployment assessment with checklist
LearningObjectives: Prove ability to deploy and troubleshoot a complete branch
PracticalLab: Lab: Deploy 2 branches, apply policies, run tests and capture results
LabSteps: 1) Run verification checklist and capture screenshots/logs
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Missed checklist items causing post-deploy tickets
TroubleshootingTips: Use automated pre-check scripts and peer-review of checklist

Title: Multi-Region Design & Hubbing
TopicsCovered: Regional hubs, scale, regional controller placement
LearningObjectives: Design scalable multi-region SD-WAN with reduced latency
PracticalLab: Lab: Create high-level multi-region design with hub pairs and failover
LabSteps: 1) Diagram regional hubs, document TLOC plans
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Asymmetric routing across regions
TroubleshootingTips: Plan for route symmetry and consistent path preferences

Title: Cloud On-Ramp (AWS/Azure/GCP)
TopicsCovered: Transit Gateways, Virtual WAN, cloud edge integration patterns
LearningObjectives: Integrate SD-WAN fabric with major cloud providers
PracticalLab: Lab: Sketch AWS Transit Gateway integration; configure cloud edge in vendor lab
LabSteps: 1) Document VPC attachments, BGP peering, and security controls
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show cloud peering status (vendor/cloud consoles)
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Suboptimal path to cloud causing latency
TroubleshootingTips: Use cloud on-ramp hubs in region and optimize local breakout

Title: SASE/SSE & Security Stack Integration
TopicsCovered: Zscaler, Prisma, Umbrella; SSE use-cases and traffic steering
LearningObjectives: Connect SD-WAN to security services for Internet-bound traffic
PracticalLab: Lab: Design and document steering internet traffic to SSE (conceptual)
LabSteps: 1) Create policy to forward internet traffic to Zscaler/Prisma
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show service-chain stats (vendor UI)
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Increased latency when hairpinning through security service
TroubleshootingTips: Use local internet breakout and select nearest SSE POP; tune policies

Title: Troubleshooting Deep Dive (CLI + Logs)
TopicsCovered: Tunnels, BFD, OMP/BGP, high CPU, flow captures, log analysis
LearningObjectives: Master a troubleshooting workflow for common and complex faults
PracticalLab: Lab: Use packet captures, log analysis and reproduce common faults
LabSteps: 1) Capture traffic on WAN and overlay; 2) Correlate logs and events
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: tcpdump/wiretrace, show process cpu, show logs
RealTimeIssues: Issue: High CPU due to DPI or flow table overload
TroubleshootingTips: Identify offending flows, adjust DPI policies or upgrade device

Title: Automation: APIs, Ansible & Scripts
TopicsCovered: Vendor REST APIs, JSON configs, Ansible playbooks, automation patterns
LearningObjectives: Automate repetitive tasks: device inventory, template push, reports
PracticalLab: Lab: Write a basic script to pull device inventory and template status via API
LabSteps: 1) Use API explorer; 2) Run sample curl or Python to fetch device list
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: curl /api/v1/devices, sample Python snippet
RealTimeIssues: Issue: API schema changes across versions break scripts
TroubleshootingTips: Version-lock automation, use API versioning and error handling

Title: High Availability & HA Patterns
TopicsCovered: Controller HA, active-active edges, VRRP/HSRP interplay, BFD tuning
LearningObjectives: Plan for controller and edge redundancy for 99.9x availability
PracticalLab: Lab: Document HA design and validate active/standby behavior in lab
LabSteps: 1) Simulate controller failover and observe edge behavior
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: show controller status, show ha summary
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Split-brain or stale config after failover
TroubleshootingTips: Ensure consistent config replication and test failovers regularly

Title: Real-World Case Studies & Lessons
TopicsCovered: Retail, Banking, Healthcare, Multi-cloud enterprises; common pitfalls
LearningObjectives: Learn from real deployments and incorporate best practices
PracticalLab: Lab: Read 3 case studies and extract design decisions and failures
LabSteps: 1) Create a lessons-learned document with mitigation strategies
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Compliance/regulation constraints in verticals
TroubleshootingTips: Document controls and involve security/compliance early

Title: Design Proposal: Full SD-WAN Solution
TopicsCovered: Architecture, IP plan, routing, security, migration, monitoring
LearningObjectives: Produce a production-ready SD-WAN design proposal
PracticalLab: Lab: Build a 10-page design doc for a sample enterprise
LabSteps: 1) Include diagrams, IP addressing, cutover plan, rollback
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Stakeholder misalignment on design goals
TroubleshootingTips: Run stakeholder reviews and produce simplified executive summary

Title: Final Assessment & Interview Prep
TopicsCovered: Review entire course, sample interview questions, portfolio prep
LearningObjectives: Demonstrate readiness for real roles and interviews
PracticalLab: Lab: Present design and troubleshooting report; complete mock interview
LabSteps: 1) Present to peer or mentor; 2) Create portfolio of lab screenshots/logs
ExampleCommandsOrChecks: N/A
RealTimeIssues: Issue: Nervousness or gaps under pressure in interviews
TroubleshootingTips: Practice mock interviews and build cheat-sheet for core commands
